description: Standard protein percentage distribution per meal type

lunch.note: Lunch: 30% of total protein - highest for muscle synthesis

dinner.note: Dinner: 25% of total protein - moderate amount, no stacking

deficit_allocation.description: When protein deficit needs to be distributed
deficit_allocation.note: 40% to lunch, 35% to breakfast, 25% to dinner

no_snacks.description: When no snacks are present, redistribute protein

source_reference: AND Position Paper: Protein Distribution Across Meals (2016)

description: Protein distribution optimized for athletes and muscle synthesis
source_reference: AND Position Paper: Nutrition and Athletic Performance (2016)

description: Protein distribution optimized for elderly to prevent sarcopenia

breakfast.note: Higher breakfast protein for muscle preservation

dinner.note: Higher dinner protein for overnight muscle synthesis

source_reference: AND Position Paper: Nutrition for Older Adults (2019)

description: Protein distribution optimized for weight loss with higher protein for satiety and muscle preservation

breakfast.note: Higher breakfast protein for satiety throughout the day

lunch.note: Substantial lunch protein for sustained satiety

dinner.note: Higher dinner protein for overnight muscle preservation

source_reference: AND Adult Weight Management Evidence-Based Nutrition Practice Guideline (2014)

description: Even protein distribution across meals optimized for muscle building and synthesis

breakfast.note: Even distribution for consistent muscle synthesis

lunch.note: Even distribution across all main meals

dinner.note: Slightly higher dinner for overnight muscle synthesis

source_reference: ISSN Position Stand: Protein and Exercise (2017)
